creator.name: Nederlands Zendelinggenootschap (NZG)
creator.his_func:
The Dutch Missionary Society (NZG) of the Dutch Reformed Church was established at the end of 1797 for the propagation and promotion of Christianity, especially among the heathen. In the early days the NZG and the London Missionary Society worked actively together.

The NZG sent one missionary to Suriname, who died in 1839. Then it worked exclusively in the Netherlands East Indies/Indonesia.
creator.notes: See also the description of the record "Nederlandsch zendeling Genootschap" in the "Repertorium van Nederlandse zendings- en missie-archieven 1800-1960".
